Note: Signed "Ioseph Pennell del." Date based on the date of the Fourth Liberty Loan Campaign. "2-B-B" appears on the bottom left of picture. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Text says to buy Liberty bonds so that liberty will not perish from the earth. Illustration shows a destroyed Statue of Liberty in the foreground, with the city behind it under attack and engulfed in fire. Poster PT030211 and Poster PT170023 show same illustration with different dimensions.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.
Physical Description: 1 poster  : orange and black ; 80 x 55 cm.
Subject: Liberty bonds -- United States.; Statue of Liberty (New York, N.Y.); World War, 1914-1918 -- Propaganda.; World War, 1914-1918 -- Finance -- United States.; War posters, American.;
